title: 20 Classic Trench Coats You’ll Have in Your Closet Forever
description: ’Tis the season for the essential outer layer.
excerpt: A trench coat is a timeless style everyone should have in their wardrobe. Shop our top picks for the classic coat from traditional colors to modern takes.
text: Go For The GreenCoach Relaxed TrenchAn olive green trench is just the thing to be wearing in the fall when you want a (neutral) pop of color. Wear it with your favorite jeans and loafers to achieve an updated, classic look. And if green isn’t your thing, the coat also comes in a traditional khaki as well.Sizes: XS-XLColors: Green, Khaki J.Crew New Icon TrenchA J.Crew trench is one that will stand the test of time, and this updated version checks all of the boxes. It’s not too long, has an adjustable belt, is water-repellent, and, best of all, has a hood that’s removable. The ideal topper for all of your favorite fall ’fits. Sizes: 00-24Colors: Vintage Khaki, Utility Green, BlackCustomer review: “This coat is beautiful, and heavier than expected in a good way. I will have this classic trench for many years to come.” Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowGrey DaysAllSaints Koko Trench Coat Looking for a neutral trench that isn’t tan or black? Try gray. This option from AllSaints will go with just about everything, while the cuff detailing and matching belt make this jacket stand out from the rest. Sizes: XS-LColors: Eiffel GreyAnything But BoringTheory Leo Relaxed Trench Coat Don’t be intimidated by this louder pattern; a leopard-print trench can be incredibly chic. Paired with black trousers or denim jeans, it can be a striking and fun addition to your wardrobe. And with the water-resistant finish, it’s perfect for any type of weather the fall might bring. It combines classic denim with a timeless silhouette, resulting in a garment you’ll have in your closet for years to come. After all, you can never go wrong with a glossy black number. Pair it with a button-up shirt, a pair of jeans, and knee-high boots, and you have yourself a fall uniform.Sizes: 2XS-2XLColors: Medium Brown, BlackStatement Maker L’Agence Celina Double-Breasted Leather Trench CoatA brown leather trench coat is a quintessential staple for your closet. Talk about an elevated and refined outerwear option. Sizes: XS-LColors: ChocolateAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowToteme Houndstooth Trench CoatThis houndstooth trench has quiet luxury written all over it. The wool is perfect when you want a trench that will keep you warmer than a typical cotton option, and this is sure to last you all season (and beyond). Sizes: 32-42Colors: BiscuitThe Best Budget PickLondon Fog Single Breasted Long Trench CoatLondon Fog’s dominion in the outerwear space is well-established, but what makes this particular design such a hit is how it marries sophistication and quality with utility and affordability. Less than $120 for a long-lasting trench coat is a steal—and it’s machine washable, no less! Sizes: S-XLColors: Brown Khaki and Black Customer review: “Very nice coat for rainy days, fits very nicely , deep pockets. You can wear this coat casually or dressy.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowClassic InvestmentBurberry Kensington Cotton Trench Coat A Burberry trench coat is arguably the most iconic when it comes to outerwear. An investment you can wear for years, there’s obviously a reason the Kensington hasn’t gone out of style after all this time. Sizes: 0-14Colors: Honey A Faux-Fur StyleAlo Yoga Sherpa TrenchWhile not a classic trench in the most technical sense, the silhouette of this faux fur coat suggests a trench influence—and, besides, the teddy material is all the rage. Size down to ensure you don’t get swallowed in all that fluff.Sizes: XXS-XLColors: Camel, Black, Espresso, and Ivory Customer review: “I mean the title in the best possible way. It’s so cozy that it feels like you’re walking around in a snuggly blanket.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowAn Extra-Long Fitebossy Double Breasted Duster Trench Coat A duster-length coat worn with a mini dress and boots? Always chic. Never misses. Best of all, this particular style is soft, sturdy and less than $75, meaning you can cure your closet envy without draining your bank account. Sizes: XS-XXLColors: 6 optionsCustomer review: “This trench is fully lined, including the sleeves which makes it easy to wear over clothes with sleeves. I like that it does not have a tie belt and instead has a fixed belt in the back for that element of trench style. All the design choices like the placket and buckle at the neck make it feel high-end. Fabric not traditional trench but it’s good. Also really like the color as well - like a lite caramel.” A Sporty LookEddie Bauer Girl On The Go Insulated Trench CoatI mean, it’s all in the name. A far cry from the typical trench but nevertheless a closet staple, Eddie Bauer’s waterproof athletic trench is a must-have for bikes, hikes, and all-terrain antics in any weather. Sizes: XS-XXL Colors: 5 optionsCustomer review: “Love the softness and grey color. Good for cold weather or take the lining out for just cool weather. The best things are that it's stylish and you can wear it in rainy weather.”Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowA Sturdy SilhouetteEverlane The Mac CoatIf you’re looking for a more structured silhouette, then look no further. This oversized Everlane option comes in three neutral colors, features a back vent, and is instantly eye-catching. Add this lightweight essential to your rotation, stat. Just think of all the layering you can do! Sizes: XXS-XLColors: Beech, Cornstalk, and BlackCustomer review: “I knew as soon as I put this on that it was perfect. Love the fit and the weight. It’s a very classy look without trying hard.”Why Trust ELLEEvery product featured on ELLE.com is independently researched, tested, or editor-approved. We only recommend products that we stand behind, and the merchandise featured on our site is always driven by editorial and product testing standards, not by affiliate deals or advertising relationships. Any content created in partnership with advertisers is marked as such.Amanda Le is a contributing writer at Hearst Magazines, where she covers fashion, beauty, lifestyle, and entertainment. In her free time, you can find her thrifting her next outfit, traveling to new cities, crushing a boxing class, or eating her way through NYC!
html:
Go For The Green

Coach Relaxed Trench

An olive green trench is just the thing to be wearing in the fall when you want a (neutral) pop of color. Wear it with your favorite jeans and loafers to achieve an updated, classic look. And if green isn’t your thing, the coat also comes in a traditional khaki as well.

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: Green, Khaki

J.Crew New Icon Trench

A J.Crew trench is one that will stand the test of time, and this updated version checks all of the boxes. It’s not too long, has an adjustable belt, is water-repellent, and, best of all, has a hood that’s removable. The ideal topper for all of your favorite fall ’fits.

Sizes: 00-24

Colors: Vintage Khaki, Utility Green, Black

Customer review: “This coat is beautiful, and heavier than expected in a good way. I will have this classic trench for many years to come.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Grey Days

AllSaints Koko Trench Coat

Looking for a neutral trench that isn’t tan or black? Try gray. This option from AllSaints will go with just about everything, while the cuff detailing and matching belt make this jacket stand out from the rest.

Sizes: XS-L

Colors: Eiffel Grey

Anything But Boring

Theory Leo Relaxed Trench Coat

Don’t be intimidated by this louder pattern; a leopard-print trench can be incredibly chic. Paired with black trousers or denim jeans, it can be a striking and fun addition to your wardrobe.

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: Beige Multi

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Cotton Cool

Barbour Marianne Waxed Cotton Trench Coat

You can always look to Barbour for a different take on a traditional trench coat. The beloved outerwear brand, known for its barn jackets, created a cotton trench that will make you an instant fan.

Sizes: 4-14

Colors: Copper Sand/Ancient Tartan

Classic With A Twist

Banana Republic Classic Cotton Trench Coat

A classic trench—that’s all we really need you to know. And with the water-resistant finish, it’s perfect for any type of weather the fall might bring.

Sizes: XS-2XL

Colors: River Bank Beige

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Classic Crossover

DL1961 Denim Trench Coat

Hear us out: Everyone should own a denim trench, and this one from DL1961 is a strong contender for your next purchase. It combines classic denim with a timeless silhouette, resulting in a garment you’ll have in your closet for years to come.

Sizes: XS-L

Colors: Blue

Super Sleek

The Frankie Shop Tina Faux Leather Trench Coat

This sleek faux leather trench will instantly elevate your look and your style. After all, you can never go wrong with a glossy black number.

Sizes: XS-XL

Colors: Black

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Keep It Khaki

COS Layered Double-Breasted Trench ﻿Coat

Thanks to a detachable liner, this trench has two looks in one. For a traditional trench look, wear it without the khaki liner, or keep it in for a modern twist.

Sizes: 2XS-L

Colors: Beige/Khaki

Olive It

La Ligne Soft Belted Trench Coat

With an A-line silhouette and olive hue, this iteration of a trench coat is one you should have on your radar. It’s sophisticated, can be dressed up or down, and is a lovely final touch for your outfit.

Sizes: XS/S, M/L

Colors: Dark Olive

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Totally Traditional

Mango Double-Breasted Cotton Trench

This jacket proves that basics can really go the distance. Pair it with a button-up shirt, a pair of jeans, and knee-high boots, and you have yourself a fall uniform.

Sizes: 2XS-2XL

Colors: Medium Brown, Black

Statement Maker

L’Agence Celina Double-Breasted Leather Trench Coat

A brown leather trench coat is a quintessential staple for your closet. Talk about an elevated and refined outerwear option.

Sizes: XS-L

Colors: Chocolate

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Toteme Houndstooth Trench Coat

This houndstooth trench has quiet luxury written all over it. The wool is perfect when you want a trench that will keep you warmer than a typical cotton option, and this is sure to last you all season (and beyond).

Sizes: 32-42

Colors: Biscuit

The Best Budget Pick

London Fog Single Breasted Long Trench Coat

London Fog’s dominion in the outerwear space is well-established, but what makes this particular design such a hit is how it marries sophistication and quality with utility and affordability. Less than $120 for a long-lasting trench coat is a steal—and it’s machine washable, no less!

Sizes: S-XL

Colors: Brown Khaki and Black

Customer review: “Very nice coat for rainy days, fits very nicely , deep pockets. You can wear this coat casually or dressy.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Classic Investment

Burberry Kensington Cotton Trench Coat

A Burberry trench coat is arguably the most iconic when it comes to outerwear. An investment you can wear for years, there’s obviously a reason the Kensington hasn’t gone out of style after all this time.

Sizes: 0-14

Colors: Honey

A Faux-Fur Style

Alo Yoga Sherpa Trench

While not a classic trench in the most technical sense, the silhouette of this faux fur coat suggests a trench influence—and, besides, the teddy material is all the rage. Size down to ensure you don’t get swallowed in all that fluff.

Sizes: XXS-XL

Colors: Camel, Black, Espresso, and Ivory

Customer review: “I mean the title in the best possible way. It’s so cozy that it feels like you’re walking around in a snuggly blanket.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

An Extra-Long Fit

ebossy Double Breasted Duster Trench Coat

A duster-length coat worn with a mini dress and boots? Always chic. Never misses. Best of all, this particular style is soft, sturdy and less than $75, meaning you can cure your closet envy without draining your bank account.

Sizes: XS-XXL

Colors: 6 options

Customer review: “This trench is fully lined, including the sleeves which makes it easy to wear over clothes with sleeves. I like that it does not have a tie belt and instead has a fixed belt in the back for that element of trench style. All the design choices like the placket and buckle at the neck make it feel high-end. Fabric not traditional trench but it’s good. Also really like the color as well - like a lite caramel.”

A Sporty Look

Eddie Bauer Girl On The Go Insulated Trench Coat

I mean, it’s all in the name. A far cry from the typical trench but nevertheless a closet staple, Eddie Bauer’s waterproof athletic trench is a must-have for bikes, hikes, and all-terrain antics in any weather.

Sizes: XS-XXL

Colors: 5 options

Customer review: “Love the softness and grey color. Good for cold weather or take the lining out for just cool weather. The best things are that it's stylish and you can wear it in rainy weather.”

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

A Sturdy Silhouette

Everlane The Mac Coat

If you’re looking for a more structured silhouette, then look no further. This oversized Everlane option comes in three neutral colors, features a back vent, and is instantly eye-catching. Add this lightweight essential to your rotation, stat. Just think of all the layering you can do!

Sizes: XXS-XL

Colors: Beech, Cornstalk, and Black

Customer review: “I knew as soon as I put this on that it was perfect. Love the fit and the weight. It’s a very classy look without trying hard.”

Why Trust ELLE

Every product featured on ELLE.com is independently researched, tested, or editor-approved. We only recommend products that we stand behind, and the merchandise featured on our site is always driven by editorial and product testing standards, not by affiliate deals or advertising relationships. Any content created in partnership with advertisers is marked as such.

Amanda Le is a contributing writer at Hearst Magazines, where she covers fashion, beauty, lifestyle, and entertainment. In her free time, you can find her thrifting her next outfit, traveling to new cities, crushing a boxing class, or eating her way through NYC!
